title-group.article-title: The Influence of Tax-Loss Selling by Individual Investors in Explaining the January Effect

abstract.p: This study provides a direct test of Ritter's (1988) extension of the tax-loss selling hypothesis. We isolate firms that are the most likely candidates for tax-loss selling. For firms that experience the largest declines in the last half of the year, we find evidence of a strong positive relation between the level of individual investor ownership and the abnormal January return in the following year and a significant negative relation between firm size and January returns. Further, firms that do experience a rebound in January are smaller and have a higher proportion of individual ownership than firms that do not rebound. Overall, this evidence is consistent with the tax-loss selling hypothesis as described by Ritter.
